channel.title: Home on Notes To An Earlier Self
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Notes To An Earlier Self

item.title: Selection Bias and the Disappointed Optimizer
item.description: Wherein I introduce and explain the mechanism behind the pervasive phenomenon in life of things being just a bit worse than expected. Have you noticed that the checkout lane you chose at the grocery store tends to be slower than you expected, the products you order off Amazon disappoint, and your second dates are not as exciting as the first ones? If you have, and are blaming this on the universe conspiring against you, youâ€™re absolutely right.

item.title: Extrapolating by Inverse Optimization
item.description: Wherein I present a simple example of a prediction problem modeled as inverse optimization and its formulation as a bilevel optimization problem, with a brief detour into Bayesian estimation. Our story begins with Alice who runs a grocery store with a small selection of locally grown produce. Alice wishes to estimate the impacts of changing the prices of her produce on the purchase behavior of her customers and wonders if the data she has been collecting over the previous year can help.

item.title: About
item.description: Some notes that I wish were available to me as I was trying to understand some of these topics.
